website_summaries.verdict: If whipping up amazingly delicious drip coffee for less is what you want, then the Bonavita BV1900TS is the best choice by far.
pros: The Bonavita BV1900TS serves up premium coffee brewing for a fraction of the price
The drip machine is also compact, easy to clean, simple to use and has a thermal carafe
cons: The Bonavita BV1900TS isn't as eye-catching as more expensive coffee makers from Technivorm

customer_reviews.title: 3-month coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Our first unit worked great for 4 months, then it started shutting off in the middle of brewing, and eventually wouldn't work at all. The company suggested that it was due to hard water build-up, though I de-scaled every month (the manual suggests every 3 months). They sent us a replacement machine (hence the 1 star) and this time I de-scaled every 2 weeks. It lasted 3 months; same problem. I have emailed the company (because there was no 'contact us' link on the order or product page), and I'll update the review when I hear from them.
customer_reviews.author: LynneS

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after two months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffe maker and used it per the manufacturer's instructions in cleaning it. I have had to replace thru the one year warranty this coffee machine fives times in that year. The coffee machine worked fine for two months and then the heating element would turn off after brewing only one or two cups of coffee. I would turn it on again and it would do the same thing. I told the company that this seems to be a manufacturer defect, but they every machine they sent me would not last more than two months. My warranty has run out and nowI have five coffee machines that don't work.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Strawther

customer_reviews.title: GREAT COFFEE BUT POOR QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this brewer I was (and still am) very happy with regards to the taste of the coffee. It makes an awesome cup. However, their are two problems with the unit. First, the filter basket does not attach to the unit. It just sits on top of the pot. For a product this expensive it should be better designed. The second problem is that after about seven months of use, the water does not empty out from the tank when I make a pot of coffee. zi need to restart the unit two or three times to completely empty it. I've tried cleaning it which helped for a couple of uses.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: 4 months later not working and warranty service is unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: I was initially thrilled with the performance of this brewer, but now 4 months later I am angry. It has suddenly started shutting off every 30-60 seconds while brewing. Not the power strip - the brewer itself shuts off. I tried call and get a message to submit warranty claim form, I try to submit warranty claim form and it errors out every time - "insufficient storage - contact claim owner" This is absolutely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: jim miller

customer_reviews.title: great coffe, really poor electronics
customer_reviews.text: makes superior coffee but this is the second one that has quit in less than 6 months. Fails to complete cycle, repeatedly shuts down. As others have stated, this product isn't worth the $ , be prepared to deal with manufacturers warranty, or buy extra coverage. October - Product replaced under warranty 12/20, now the free warranty replacement unit is doing the same as the previous 2. That's right, 3 now. Maybe the company hopes people just get annoyed and go away, we will see.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: Poorly engineered drip coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this coffee maker so as to enjoy a better and hotter cup of coffee. Loved it for the first two months. Then it started to shut off midstream while brewing. Now it does it every 2-cups that brews making it so we have to keep pushing the on/brew button until all the water has trickled down through and into the carafe!!! This seems to be an ongoing defect for their poorly engineered coffee brewers! I had read this review before we purchased but ignored it! Wish we had listened! Still waiting to hear back from the Bonivita company! Think long and hard before purchasing this product! Terry and Kathy S.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Lois Stanaway

customer_reviews.title: The grounds holder sits in the carafe while brewing so you have to take off the lid and put it back on each time - sounds dumb, but it's a hassle
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is really putzy. The grounds holder sits in the carafe while brewing so you have to take off the lid and put it back on each time - sounds dumb, but it's a hassle! And, because the grounds holder is in the carafe, when you take it out you'll drip coffee everywhere. You can't remove the carafe and pour a cup until the brewing is totally done. And it is REALLY slow. This was not at all what I thought I was buying - it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Brews a really good tasting cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Brews a really good tasting cup of coffee. Just fool around with the grounds until you get the taste you want. The carafe keeps the coffee hot for hours. The one problem is the pouring spout on the carafe...when filling the water container, the water spills all over the place due to a poor design. You can put the regular pouring top on and use that top fill the water container, but it takes forever due to the design. Very well designed and no fancy buttons to push, looks good on the kitchen counter....but fix the carafe.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hermanson

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee until it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Thought I found the perfect coffee maker - simple to use and good coffee. This was true for about a year and then the coffee maker stopped brewing all the water. Cleaning and descaling several times did nothing. For the price, it should have lasted longer. Others have had the same problem. There is simply something wrong with the quality of this appliance. Update: I'm a sucker for a good cup of coffee. Bought another Bonavita - this time with the glass carafe. After just 3 months the heating plate is rusting. Again something is definitely wrong with Bonavita quality
customer_reviews.author: Lady Sadie

customer_reviews.title: Brewer Shuts off
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker makes great coffee when it works but the brewer shuts off continually. This Bonavita coffee maker is the second one that I've owned. The first one quit working after two years and I thought that I would give another one a try. I've owned this brewer for 7 months. I've contacted Bonavita and they recommended a Descaler solution. That seemed to help at first but now, even though the solution was continually used, as recommended, the brewer is shutting off again. I wished that I hadn't bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: suzymo79

customer_reviews.title: The best coffee maker I have owned with one very small complaint.
customer_reviews.text: Having used this for a couple of months now, I am pleased with it. I will take quality over features any day of the week. My only complaint is that as you set the filter box on the carafe, This unit feels messy on your counter. either the carafe pour cap is on your counter or the filter box is. But still glad for the purchase the taste of the actual coffee is fantastic. I use fresh beans with a burr grinder. I do advise letting the grounds sit for a few minutes after grinding but before brewing. I read and agree that this helps with more acidic beans.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating product
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this product, I appreciate it's great design and smaller size. BUT- this is my third purchase of this coffee maker. My first is at our vacation home. It is the oldest and works perfectly. But -some corners were cut in making the last two that have broken after about 14- months in our permanent home. When you press start it only brews partially and shuts off. It often has to be restarted as many as 7-times before it finishes! This same problem has occurred in the last two purchased coffee makers. I'm officially done with this inferior manufacturing!
customer_reviews.author: Cary E. Kenner

customer_reviews.title: I hate this. Now I am looking a French presses ...
customer_reviews.text: I only had this coffee maker three months and it decided to only make two cups, then four, then eight and then four. Had to stand by it and keep pushing the button to get it to finish brewing. The manufacturer does not get back to us after phone calls and e-mails. I hate this. Now I am looking a French presses and percolators. It made great coffee for two months.
customer_reviews.author: Stephania Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Not Hot Enough
customer_reviews.text: Coffee flavor is fine, but temperature is not nearly hot enough. Customer support claims that "the brewer is designed to brew 8 cups at 195-205°F." Here's the catch: "The temperature in the carafe immediately after brewing 8 cups is typically 175-185°F" and they'll replace it if it's under 175. I tested our coffee temp immediately after brewing and it was just below 175. Again, not hot enough, and not worth replacing for another couple degrees.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Makes decent coffee, but a defective machine
customer_reviews.text: Upon a recommendation in Cooks Illustrated as the best lower priced coffee maker, I purchased this Bonavita. The first machine I received had a faulty switch and I had to exchange it. The next one has started leaking when it brews, and brewed coffee pools at the base, and the insulated pot leaks when you pour. I don't know if I can return this one as it is over 30 days old. I am really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J. G. Bispo

customer_reviews.title: Coffee house quality coffee at home!
customer_reviews.text: I have never written a review on here before...until now. This is after many purchases. This product is life changing! I didn't believe the reviews about being able to taste the subtle notes in the coffee, but now I can confirm this is accurate! In addition, I can have coffee house quality coffee in the comfort of my own home. If you are on the fence about buying this, definitely just buy it. I had a CuisinArt prior to this coffee maker and while it made great coffee, it doesn't come close to the flavor profiles that this machine has introduced with the same coffees that I have been drinking for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bargain price for top performer
customer_reviews.text: This is the machine that makes your friends and guests say spontaneous nice things about the coffee you serve. Burr ground Peet’s Major Dickason’s Blend and this machine are the answer. After approximately 1200 pots brewed, it began to shut off with only half of the water through it. So I just bought a new one. At 10 cents per pot of coffee, I got a lot and I’m starting fresh. Like my coffee.
customer_reviews.author: descendent of Bill Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Bonivita 1900ts
customer_reviews.text: It is a quick and easy coffee machine to use and does make a good coffee . The only gripe I do have is the coffee pot. With the lid on coffee pot it's good. But if you need to fill a thermos up without lid the pour design on coffee pot makes a mess filling larger cups or thermos.It does make a great cup of coffee and generally for the home it's perfect. Just be carefull pouring into larger containers and use a funnel.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product, Well Designed
customer_reviews.text: Excellent coffee maker. I really like this product. Key positive features are: Easy to clean: Simply remove coffee filter from pot, place paper filter into trash and rinse filter container. Filter design: Hot water is dispensed from multiple holes instead of just one. This ensures coffee grounds are evenly saturated. Easy to fill water basin: Large opening minimizes spills Keeps coffee hot: Metal carafe holds coffee heat well. Lid design keeps pot opening closed until ready to pour coffee. I would have given this 5 stars except for the fact that the pot only holds 8 cups of coffee. A 10 cup product would rate a "5".
customer_reviews.author: gerald williams

customer_reviews.title: Lukewarm Mediocre Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have used this coffee maker for a few months now. As a result, I have drank more lukewarm in the past few months than I have in my entire life. I cannot drink it fast enough to keep it warm. In addition, the coffee does not takes a good as from my 8 year old Cuisinart coffee maker. I would not recommend the carafe version as you will end up drinking lukewarm coffee. I am going to give this away and by a different coffee maker. Life is too short to drink lukewarm coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, did everything as advertised. If you use good coffee and or beans it will make good coffee. Right after the return time expired for Amazon, we had to deal with Bonavita customer service, first replacement had a different issue, second replacement is working properly. This is to praise Tamie from customer service, she was great to deal with. She guided us to try to fix the issues on the second machine to no avail and sent us a brand new unit. Thank you Tamie for not forgetting what customer service is supposed to be and being a nice person.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just another Brewer in the Landfill
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee maker because I was under the impression that it would last longer than a typical brewer. However, it just died, just 18 months later. I just noticed that others reviews where others have reported failure after just over a year and just like those reports, the unit just stop working. So once again, another brewer ends up in the landfill, what a waste of resources and time. I'm still not done, in search of a brewer built to last, just purchased a Moccamaster. Apparently brewers are all they do, so hopefully they make them to last.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Makes GREAT HOT COFFEE, and FAST!  SIMPLE DESIGN
customer_reviews.text: So simple to use; I cannot recall loving a coffee pot this much. I can fill the well quickly & easily with my sink hose, add the filter and the coffee, turn it on, and VOILA. In about 3 minutes, you get the best REALLY HOT coffee. Finally!!! Most every other coffee pot I've owned--and there have been many--required a contortionist's arms and wrists to fill the well, standing on your tiptoes, and splashing water everywhere. I know you KNOW what I mean! This one is best, hands down. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie M. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Only worked 7 months. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this machine. Did lots of research before we purchased. Coffee maker stopped working Christmas morning. This machine lasted 7 months. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: flagrandma

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps this machine makes great coffee--we never got that far. In running the initial set-up with water, the carafe leaked near the top when pouring the water out. Tried multiple times to rethread the lid in case there was something we were doing wrong. Same result each time. We were excited about this big upgrade from our Mr. Coffee machine, only to discover it wasn't an upgrade. Carafe is either poorly designed or poorly manufactured. It's not that complicated to do right in either event. For $150, this machine should be nothing but "5" reviews. Didn't want to take a chance on a replacement, so we returned.
customer_reviews.author: JekyllIslandSnowBird

customer_reviews.title: Why is no one talking about the terrible carafe?!
customer_reviews.text: Makes a delicious cup of coffee but you spill half of it while pouring. Seriously, I tried every way I could think of to pour it and at best, I still ended up with about a quarter of a cup full on the counter. Huge design flaw. But I guess it’s a good thing a lot of the coffee is spilled because by the time you get to drinking the last of it, it’ll be cold. Carafe is terrible all the way around! And you can’t just get a different carafe because the filter basket actually sits down inside of it some to keep it in place while it brews.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hayward

customer_reviews.title: If, you want the best cup of coffee ever.
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a 5 cup Bonavita machine and it was OK. I felt the coffee needed to be hotter to reach optimum flavor points. This model with the glass carafe meets all of my requirements and really unveils the flavor of the beverage. I now experiment to find my optimum supplier and roast level of coffee. I am using a scale to load the correct amount of coffee (for me) in the basket. The hot plate does a great job, but I do use an insulated carafe to stretch out my addiction over the course of the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Tarelka

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee maker for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is specially coffe association certified. Brews around 203F and produces a cup of coffee better than any other maker I’ve owned. I have a muring I love for the cup in the afternoon/evening but kind of pricey for morning consumption. With this maker I can make 3 or 4 American cups of coffee much cheaper. The thermal carafe keeps it tasty and reasonably hot to the last cup. It has a good warranty so compare this to the moccamaster and this pot wins the cost analysis. If you use distilled water it should never wear out
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple Design. Good Coffee. Stopped working after one year.
customer_reviews.text: If you prefer simplicity of design over all else this is the brewer for you. One switch and no settings. The water temp, water dispenser, and other brewing matters make a good cup of coffee. The design of the carafe is terrible. You can't pour out of it with the lid off without spilling water. So to fill the reservoir is tricky. With the lid on, it pours unbearable slow. To pour out the last cup of coffee takes about 30 seconds. Also, the heat retention of the carafe is less than some others I had in the past, although I wouldn't actually say it's bad.
customer_reviews.author: ShannonG

customer_reviews.title: very good coffee
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a cuisinart that stopped working after less than 1 year with this one. The cuisinart often did not brew a good cup. The coffee is much better with this one-- often excellent. (We are quite fussy We use starbucks coffee and grind it fresh and drink it black without sweetener) It is also easier to pour the water into the reservoir. The opening is larger the water would often spill outside the opening with the cuisinart. The carafe is also an improvement vs the cuisinart- less spill
customer_reviews.author: ksredhook

customer_reviews.title: Great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Best cup of coffee I’ve ever had from an automatic drip. Brews quick as lightning (4 minutes for a whole pot, 8 cups). Only issues: Carafe doesn’t seem to stay hot very long. When done brewing, let it sit for a couple minutes with carafe still under basket. Quite a bit of coffee will still drip out.
customer_reviews.author: IndyMcGinley

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by America's Test Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: ATK recommended it because unlike many drip coffeemakers, especially cheap ones, this one will heat the water to the higher temperatures needed to brew a more flavorful cup. I would recommend that to keep coffee hotter for longer, you need to fill the carafe with hot tap water before brewing to bring the temperature up. It keeps my coffee hot for at least 3 hours and unlike coffee makers using glass carafes and heating elements underneath, it will not "scorch" the coffee. Use filtered water from a Brita faucet or pitcher and there are products available to run through the machine 2 - 3 times a year to remove any mineral buildup on the heating element.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved this coffeemaker when I bought it September 14
customer_reviews.text: Loved this coffeemaker when I bought it September 14, 2017, but this morning it stopped working - would not turn on! Amazon will not accept a return for this item after October 14th. I'll go through the manufacturer I guess. Very disappointed about a product that has been highly reviewed.
customer_reviews.author: R G Reed

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this coffee maker. I can really tell the difference in the flavor of coffee. I was getting dizzy doing research on coffee makers I finally decided on this and absolutely no regrets. I have read reviews complaining about the thermal carafe not keeping the coffee hot for a long enough period. I pretty much brew the amount of coffee that I am going to be drinking /serving for an hour or so and then brew more if needed. The biggest difference I can cite is the flavor of the coffee which comes with this high-quality coffee maker. 9 Month Follow up: Still very pleased with this purchase. Bottom line makes a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Chesbay

customer_reviews.title: The Best Drip Coffee Maker on the Market
customer_reviews.text: A bit pricy, but a good value for those who want to make good coffee as simply as possible. The carafe is thermal, and will keep coffee hot all morning, the poor spout thermos top works great, the product quality is between good and excellent. Someone put some thought into how to make a really good quality drip coffee maker, from the brew temperature of the water to the pouring, storing (thermos), and clean-up. I have a variety of other coffee makers - mocha/espresso pots, pour over, french press, etc., but I use this over 90% of the time due to the simplicity and quality of the coffee it makes.
customer_reviews.author: Walter V Finn

customer_reviews.title: Did not work out for us
customer_reviews.text: The carafe was barely “thermal”. Despite pre-heating the carafe by running 40 oz. of water through it, the coffee temperature dropped from 180°F at brewing to 133°F in 35 minutes. This doesn’t meet the needs of a household on diverse schedules. Yes, I could pour it into a ThermosTM, but I could get a ChemexTM plus a ThermosTM for less money and babysit it only slightly less. It was returned after only 2 uses. The brew was good. If you are drinking it all in one go, go for it. Also, the exposed brewing basket operates bit louder than I’m accustomed to.
customer_reviews.author: BklnQ

customer_reviews.title: Not just junk
customer_reviews.text: This product is not just junk, but a RIPOFF!. There are lots of reviews about it starting to malfunction shortly after the 2 year warranty. I ignored those and bought it anyway. Because of the reviews I only used filtered water (we don't have hard water but I thought I should be extra careful). I followed the instructions and used the recommended products to regularly clean and descale - and of course, after about 2 years it stopped working. Stops brewing about half way thru and you have to wait and restart it -- basically it is now useless.
customer_reviews.author: Summerlander

customer_reviews.title: Bought the steel carafe version — very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Better coffee than our old coffee maker made, but that steel, thermal carafe is great. It has a cap that allows you to pour the coffee thru it without spilling a drop. Had been tired of sloshing coffee down the side of the cup with previous coffee maker carafes. Love the 12.2” height of this Bonavita, too. A very minor nuisance to have to find some place to put the filter basket after brewing. The coffee is plenty hot for us. Really wouldn't want it hotter or it may not be good for our throats and esophaguses.
customer_reviews.author: T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: None better from coffee freaks
customer_reviews.text: You can do the research (we did) on your own or just rely on this and many other reviews from people who have bought the Bonavita. We have given them as gifts to our kids. We just bought another one too. The temp on this is just where it needs to be - around 202. It is a simple machine and frankly if you are a coffee guy or lady, this is all you need. The carafe keeps the coffee hot for a long time. One of the best products we have ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Been wanting a Bonavita for a long time and when the price dropped a short time ago finally broke down and got it. Simple one switch controls (I don't need nor want all the extra bells and whistles) Very simple and nicely made, an attractive addition to our kitchen. Great tasting coffee made at the right temperature and really like the double wall carafe. Haven't regretted spending the money on it, just wish it was made in a 10cup size.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Seriously good coffee
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker was a game-changer for me. It really opens up the many complex layers of flavor in good coffee. It makes me genuinely happy every morning! Plus, I like it's simplicity and elegant design. My only issue is that I had a unit fail after a couple months use. Bonavita did eventually send a replacement, but they weren't exactly speedy about it. I have seen in other reviews that people have had similar issues, so just a heads up.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: I received this unit this morning - very quick order and delivery from Amazon. After multiple futile attempts to brew - complete failure. It turns on and immediately turns off. Read and reread the manual - it's not the preinfusion mode. Guessing it is some kind of sensor defect. Very disappointed because I was looking forward to HOT coffee as advertised. It is going back - sorry Amazon - not your fault. Bonavita has some work to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great brewer, but does not hold up.
customer_reviews.text: My second Bonavita in 2 years just stopped working. The first one was replaced by Bonavita (they do stand by their product) after it was having issues completing cycles. Also, the water tank was starting to melt. (and yes, I use descaler regularly). They sent me a new one, which just quit working. No half cycles this time. Just...nothing. Two units in two years. Not a good track record. It's too bad because it does make a great cup of coffee. But I don't think I can go for 3 in 3 years. Time to find another make.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Karr

customer_reviews.title: Recommended as Best Featured at a Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker was recommended by a consumer testing service on YouTube as the best of the best. Very reasonable price. Simple to use and clean. One note that the manual did not explain: the carafe and upper filer holder must be aligned vertically to the water spray vents otherwise the on/off button does not respond. Other than that minor hiccup which drove me crazy until I figured it out, it brews excellent coffee.
customer_reviews.author: G Dog

customer_reviews.title: Coffee is not Hot!
customer_reviews.text: This product was a huge disappointment. After reading the reviews, I thought it would be a great product. The coffee is warm, not hot immediately after brewing. The plate that the pot sits on is not heated and the carafe does not keep the coffee warm. I brew 2 cups every morning. After I finish my first cup, I have to microwave the second cup. This is a terrible product. Save yourself the money and buy a cheap Mr. Coffee.
customer_reviews.author: T mack

customer_reviews.title: Design changes disappoint
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our old Bonavita model, which we loved, with this one. We are. not nearly as happy with this coffee maker. The old model had a glass liner to the carafe and the coffee stayed hog much longer. The removal of the glass liner not only makes the coffee in the carafe cool more rapidly, it also gives the carafe a cheap, tinny sound when it is placed on any hard surface. Also, the new pouring spout produces an uneven stream of coffee. Go back to the old model, Bonavita!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Eileen Klitsch

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee but terrible carafe
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Bonavita for a few months. It is a great coffee maker with one caveat. The carafe has a lip on the inside that makes pouring from it a messy job. You will get dribbles for sure. It also means you can't fully empty the pot even when you turn it upside down. Bonavita gives a lid you need to twist on that keeps the heat in and prevents dribbles when pouring. But if I am only making one cup, I want to just pour it into my mug. Messy. On the positive side, the coffee is great. Noticeably better than my old Mr. Coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: AK399

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Two Died in 9 Months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought original unit about 9 months ago. It failed after a couple months. Now, aAfter a few months, the free replacement just failed (won’t pump the water). I’m pretty sure we’ll be replacing this trash with a cheap Mr Coffee type unit. On the good news front, the carafe is nice.
customer_reviews.author: MikeDidIt

customer_reviews.title: Carafe needs total redesign.  Awkward, pours slowly, dribbles, and heavy.
customer_reviews.text: After three days of use, I am not happy with this coffee maker. The good points. Coffee brews quickly and at correct temperature. It is quiet. It shuts off automatically after brewing. Here are the problems. Thermal carafe is awkward and heavy, it pours very slowly when lid is on and dribbles when lid is off (to fill reservoir), and it does not keep coffee hot very long. (I now see why one reviewer drilled a bigger hole in the lid). After an hour in carafe, coffee needs reheating. So I am still searching for something to replace my simple ancient Braun drip coffeemaker which was discontinued many years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjosemom

customer_reviews.title: Great machine! I was worried that the footprint would ...
customer_reviews.text: Great machine! I was worried that the footprint would be too large for our counter but when we replaced our old (standard vertical drip machine) it actually feels smaller. The way the water drips on the grounds makes for a more flavorful pot of coffee. I also like that this design forces me to clean up the grounds immediately after the coffee is finished - I can't allow myself to be lazy and let them sit. However, I do wish there were a logical place to put the lid when not in use - maybe a hook on the side of the machine or something.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Turns out I actually like it better - easier to clean and dry
customer_reviews.text: I had reservations about this coffee maker as I was concerned that having the filter sitting ontop of the pot would be a bit of a pain in the a**. Turns out I actually like it better - easier to clean and dry. Makes a pot of coffee very quickly, but I do find myself using a bit more coffee than my old cone style filter. The only thing that would make this unit better would be a beeper to let you know when it's done brewing, but relly it is so quick that I don't miss that feature very much.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn S

customer_reviews.title: Satisfying design. Great coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this maker every day for a few months now. The design is just a pleasure to work with. The carafe keeps coffee warm for hours using the double walled design. The shower head drip is nice so that you're not drinking plastic water like some other makers out there. There's an alternate mode which allows the coffee to soak for a minute before it starts doing the actual dripping. The way the carafe fits perfectly into the slot on the maker and the way the pouring lid screws onto the carafe is just so satisfying. Coffee turns out excellent!
customer_reviews.author: revallion93

customer_reviews.title: Silly design, don’t waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: This is the dumbest design of a coffee pot I’ve ever seen. Sure, it’s easy to clean because it doesn’t even actually connect together. The basket literally sits on top of the carafe. There is no burner to reheat the coffee once it is cold. Dumb. There is no timer to have your coffee brew at wake up time. The carafe is bulky and awkward and has to be disassembled to brew as the basket rests on the mouth of the carafe during the brew. Buy a bunny or spend a bit more on something well designed.
customer_reviews.author: Clif

customer_reviews.title: Superb Costumer Service!
customer_reviews.text: We bought our Bonavita more than a year ago, and had a few issues along the way. Each and every single time, the customer service was very patient, super kind and helpful. Usually you get frustrated when a product you have invested does not work properly after you follow all the instructions about how you should take care of it, but this time, we are so humbled with the customer care that we received from Bonavita that we felt bad. I almost wanted to say, don't worry about it, it's just a coffee machine, all is fine :) Amazing staff! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: hunbaar

customer_reviews.title: Worst carafe
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffeemaker, but the carafe may be the worst designed object I have ever used. It is impossible to pour out the last  ̃2 ounces. Even taking the lid off and shaking it upside down vigorously leaves a little bit of liquid inside. It's like the engineers finished working on the coffeemaker itself, gave themselves a round of high-fives, then let a marketing intern design the carafe.
customer_reviews.author: Erik N.

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, but the design could be better
customer_reviews.text: What I like: This coffee maker makes outstanding coffee. The design is straightforward, with few bells and whistles, and without a complicated set of instructions. There's little than can go wrong. The carafe is nice, though, in my experience, it doesn't keep the coffee hot for more than 3-4 hours. What could be better: You can't store this as a single unit, as the filter basket and the top of the carafe won't fit together above the carafe. So you need to either store the carafe top or the filter basket separately.
customer_reviews.author: J Morel

customer_reviews.title: great coffee. great service.
customer_reviews.text: We received a new coffee maker about 2 months ago. from the start it made good coffee but the onoff switch didn't work well. It would turn on and the pop back off. Once finally running everything was fine. I emailed customer support describing the problem and the next thing I knew, they shipped a new brewer. No pot or lids just the brewer. No cost, no need to return the old brewer. the new brewer works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: the quality of the coffee is great, maybe the best I have experienced so I ...
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this 5 stars but for the carafe. It does not keep the coffeee hot enough to drink much past an hour. It's very hot coming out of the brew cycle. By one hour it has cooled but still ok. After another 15 minutes it's borderline and past that I have to warm it up in the microwave. I have only had it about a week, the quality of the coffee is great, maybe the best I have experienced so I have to come to a decision if I want to keep it or find another thermal coffee maker that does a better job of keeping the coffee hot. Maybe none of these thermal coffee makers do any better.
customer_reviews.author: AFG008

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: This coffee machine does make good coffee. However, the machines are unreliable. I've consistently had problems with the power switch. The first unit Bonavita refused to replace or service because it was barely out of warranty. Thankfully, Amazon provided a free replacement (a value of over $100.00 at the time). The second machine a received is now having the same issue (power switch is beginning to fail). This happened after only one month of use and I am now attempting a warranty repair with Bonavita a second time.
customer_reviews.author: Justin McKey

customer_reviews.title: Makes good coffee fast.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to be a gift but have used it many times while visiting. I prefer Bunn but this is an impressive machine. It is as fast as my Bunn but it doesn’t have to be on all the time. It is so easy to use, looks good, fast and makes great tasting coffee.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed. This pot does not make coffee any hotter than my old Mr. Coffee even after preheating the pot and the coffee cups. And the lid is very hard to get on - you have to find the magic spot that the grooves will catch and then turn 1 1/2 times. The pot is hard to clean and you can never get the very last of the coffee unless you turn it upside down completely and then it goes everywhere. I wish I had returned it. Only good thing - it looks nice on the counter
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee flavor!
customer_reviews.text: My second BonaVita. My old one lasted about 8 years. I had to replace the carafe once but it was covered by warranty from the shop I bought it from—Batdorf and Bronson of Olympia, WA. The carafe on this one is much lighter and keeps Coffee at the correct temp for over an hour— how long it takes for us to drink the pot! Love the feature that allows the coffee to bloom. Superior flavor. I’ve only had it for 2 weeks but very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: consumer

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and attractive!
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker makes excellent coffee (I like Peets' African blends, expresso grind). I also like that it is WHITE instead of tedious "stainless". The carafe IS a thermos, better than the regular Bonavita stainless carafe that looks like a thermos but isnt. However, every time its poured it loses heat, which all thermoses do, so don't be cross if the coffee goes cold. The best thing is, the coffee doesn't STEW, doesn't sit for hours (or one hour) cooking. So it is re-heatable. Did I mention I like the white color?
customer_reviews.author: Fozzetti

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed. Didn't last six months - "Out of protection window" in three months!
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee maker. but I would never buy Bonvita again. Not even sure I'd buy electronic devices from Amazon again. I should have checked, but three months customer protection is ridiculous. Now 5 1/2 months after purchasing this device, we're in the market for a new coffee pot. Friends of ours had just told us of how their identical Bonvita had just quit working after only two months - so they were still covered. Their coffee maker and ours quit turning on. Bad switches or bad elements make for BAD PRODUCTs.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Neighbors

customer_reviews.title: Good maker, but mine failed.
customer_reviews.text: First unit didn’t work right. Hit start button then turned off. Did this 2-3 times sometimes more to get it to start and then finally brew. Didn’t want to take the risk of premature complete failure and returned.
customer_reviews.author: Skyline

customer_reviews.title: The coffee maker that leaks.
customer_reviews.text: We have used this brand of coffee maker in the past with good success. However it quitting workings after around 4-5 years so we purchased another one. It arrived today and our first pot of coffee leaked all over the counter. There was a leak in the seal between the stainless steel carafe and the plastic top (not the removable top). There was no apparent damage to the product or the box it was shipped in. We filled out the warranty form. I’m not sure I would buy this product again because it appears they don’t do product testing.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker, very bad carafe
customer_reviews.text: The good : it is fast and makes very tasty coffee. It evenly distributes water, and has no trouble with fresh coffee if the pause feature is used The bad: The carafe is very bad. It is impossible to pour without the lid and not spill. If the lid is used the carafe retains 1/4th of a cup. If you are not going to drink all the coffee quickly then you will need to pre-heat the carafe, otherwise your coffee will be tepid within the hour. If you preheat for 5min with hot water it will last several hours.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Super Tasting Coffee with Super Expense but one small downside...
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee tasting - I didn't think coffee makers make that much of a difference but they do. The coffee tastes so good from this machine. The carafe design is awful, You can not get all the water out - you must turn upside down and wipe around rim with paper towel. hat being said, the coffee is so good without spending $400 on a machine that we kept it and would order another because of the great taste. Cant they just redesign the carafe???
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A Green

customer_reviews.title: Simply Makes Good Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Bonavita for over 2 years and I am quite happy. It is absolutely no frills and makes very good coffee (assuming you use decent ground coffee). The thing I like best is it comes all apart for easy cleaning and snaps back together. The narrow mouth on the pot is a little tough to get into to thoroughly clean but everything else works fine. Brews a full pot in about 6 minutes and stays hot for about 3 hours. No complaints. Simple is good.
customer_reviews.author: Max Meltdown

customer_reviews.title: Will not honor warranty-dishonest company-
customer_reviews.text: Won’t honor Warranty- DONT BUY THIS COFFEE MAKER! The coffee pot makes ok coffee, no better than the cheap brands. It is over heating and the company is playing games, had to send in 2 long requests for a refund or replacement, the company has denied it twice, claiming I did not use the correct cleaner. It’s obvious that they are pushing back so they don’t have to pay.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth koenig

customer_reviews.title: Two shortfalls otherwise a good coffee brewer
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent coffee brewer. I’ll keep it. The main thing I don’t like is there is a deep undercut on the pourspout which means not all the coffee is able to be poured out of the carafe, there isn’t even flow among the 10 spickets and some didn’t work at all. Finally, it’s not a drawback, but I prefer a sleeker carafe, this one’s kind of bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Rick.CivisCaelium

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old, less expensive, Black & Decker coffee maker. Even with the same grounds, there's a big taste and temperature improvement. I love the simple, one button operation, with no bells & whistles. There's no hot plate to scorch your coffee or the bottom of the carafe. It's just good coffee. For the other reviewer that said they found a cup that fit under the basket so you can brew directly into the cup, I have discovered that my 20oz Yeti tumbler also fits. I haven't tried to brew into it, but it certainly seems possible.
customer_reviews.author: J. Temple

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: It works exactly as the vendor says it does. I've had mine for a while now, and I love it. In order to show off a coffee maker this good, you need to grind your own beans. It helps if they were recently roasted. if you generally buy Folgers from the grocery store, get something cheap. This coffee pot won't make that big of a difference. But if you're passionate about your coffee and you use high quality beans, the Bonavita is a great thing to have. It heats the water to the right temperature and it keeps the water on the grounds for the right amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Makes delicious coffee!
customer_reviews.text: The Bonavita glass coffee brewer definitely makes the most delicious coffee at home. I like the glass carafe as I can see how much coffee is in it, and the warmer never times out before the pot is empty.. The only dislike I have is that the filter holder sits on top of the pot & has to be removed with the pot, before pouring the coffee. There is no slot to slide it into, like other brands, so I have to remove it and sit it somewhere and then pour the coffee. Otherwise, I make the most delicious, aromatic cups of coffee, which competes with the best baristas.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee!
customer_reviews.text: After researching coffee makers, I decided on the Bonavita. I'm very glad I did! It makes an exceptional cup of coffee. It is easy to use and I like the look and functionality of the carafe. Two things I wish Bonavita offered 1) 10 or 12 cup model and 2) an alert sound to let you know when it is done brewing. Other than that, I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Soshie Young

customer_reviews.title: Makes Great Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Stylish coffee maker that makes great coffee. You brew with the lid removed from the thermal carafe. May seem inconvenient but eliminates those times with other coffee makers when you think the coffee carafe is under the basket properly and it isn't and the entire pot brews all over the counter and into your cabinets. No chance with this coffee maker unless you forget to put the pot under the basket entirely !
customer_reviews.author: Scud

customer_reviews.title: Best cup of coffee ever
customer_reviews.text: I love the taste of the coffee that this coffee maker brews. It is the best cup I've ever had. It doesn't boil the water so it doesn't burn the coffee grounds making the coffee full of flavor. It takes just a few minutes to brew. It has the basket sit right on top of the carafe where the brewed water steeps through the grounds and into the carafe. The stainless steel carafe keeps it warm for a long time. I will never go back to a regular coffee maker again. The only thing I wish is that it made more cups. I get about 2-1/2 16 oz cups but wish it would make more for company.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: One Helluva Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I've been a French press guy for years but had recently heard filtered coffee is in fact the better way to go. This machine had everything I was looking for in the price range AND it brews in less time than it took for me to make French press. If I had it to do over again, I would not have got the thermal carafe. It doesn't keep the coffee all the hot, it doesn't pour well and is difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.author: plainandtall

customer_reviews.title: I like how this works
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker makes good coffee. The insulated carafe holds the heat for quite a long time. It does not have a heating plate which is a good thing so that the coffee does not continue cooking. I see only one potential weak point that is the water container lid. If one is careless you cold break it, but to do that would be difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Makes excellent coffee. Few convenience/design features.
customer_reviews.text: Makes excellent coffee. Mediocre design/convenience features. Makes better tasting coffee than any previous CM I've had, including Mr. Coffee and Cuisinart. Brews quickly. Insulated pot keeps hot for several hours. But: - Not programmable. One-button to brew. That's it. - Must use screwable carafe lid to pour. Pouring coffee from naked carafe (w/o lid) spills. - Carafe opening barely wide to fit hand inside for washing. - No warming plate - just well-insulated pot. - No chime to alert when brewing done. Light on switch goes dark.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Kariya

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to keep clean
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this coffee pot for about 6 months. Pros: great coffee, simple design, super easy to keep clean, fits under my counter. Cons: as other reviewers have mentioned, the carafe is not as good at keeping the coffee hot for hours. If you drink your coffee in an hour or so, it is no problem. It is not hard to nuke it, if necessary. Neutral: I wasn’t sure I’d like the filter basket sitting directly on the carafe, but find it has been a non issue.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible re-design from the older model. lukewarm coffee carafe
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a replacement for our last Bonavita coffee maker. Our old machine had a glass carafe that kept the coffee for a long time. This model has a stainless carafe that basically sucks and keeps the coffee warm at best. The water spray head has a huge gap between the filter holder and the maker which further cools down the coffee. Last but not least the water sprays out of the maker unevenly so half the grounds are soaked and the other half are partially wet. I would say try to find the old model as this one is crap.
customer_reviews.author: Red Hook

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this coffee pot to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this coffee pot to anyone. If you drink the coffee immediately, it will be hot but it cools down within minutes of brewing. The warmer element does not stay on for 2 hours either. I have never been more disappointed in a coffee machine, especially spending this kind of money only to be stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bellmyer

customer_reviews.title: Get an un damaged product
customer_reviews.text: Customer service is bad, product quality is questionable. I love the coffee maker and coffe taste, however the plastic washer inside the cover has fallen apart really fast and now the top does not shut right and drips. I have gotten the run around in customer service. Not dealing with the issues immediately ???? I will not have trouble getting the pat replaced!?
customer_reviews.author: BeBe.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Power switch filed after 6 weeks - conveniently 2 weeks after the return window expired.
customer_reviews.author: mchull

customer_reviews.title: Great coffeemaker, Terrible coffeepot
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic coffeemaker really gets the water good and hot and brews two cups in minutes. But you had better make 2-1/2 cups because you’ll never get the last half cup of coffee out. You have to hold the carafe upside down and even then you won’t get the last of the coffee out. Worst designed coffeepot I ever used. But the coffeemaker is awesome. SMH
customer_reviews.author: Michel

customer_reviews.title: Not hot
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful machine and easy to use. Makes a very good cup of coffee. The two issues I had and feel like they are a deal breaker for me is that the water temperature seems way too cool for my taste and the thermal carafe really does not keep the coffee warm at all. I believe the water temperature is about 170 degrees Fahrenheit at best when it enters the pot and RAPIDLY drops from there. Almost from the first cup of coffee, I have had to heat it up a little in the microwave. Perhaps there are tips and tricks in other reviews that can help.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Leone

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.  Not as good as the old models.
customer_reviews.text: We owned two older models of Bonavita coffee makers for years that had glass linings in the carafes. They made great coffee -- rich, smooth, consistent. But unfortunately, both glass liners shattered spontaneously this past year so we had to replace them. Since Bonavita doesn't make replacement carafes with the glass liner, (obviously, the shattering didn't just happen to us) we decided to try the new model with the stainless liner. Big mistake. The coffee doesn't taste anywhere near as good. We gave it away and are now using a french press until I can find a new brand that I'm willing to try.
customer_reviews.author: JMcL

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee BUT.......
customer_reviews.text: The carafe is thermal but does NOT keep coffee hot for extended periods of time. If you like strong coffee and you use extra scoops of coffee per pot, we use 12 scoops for 8 cups, that is about the max the basket will hold w/o there being coffee grounds in the pot. I am disappointed that we can't make coffee stronger due to filter basket size. Coffee maker is easy to use but definitely has limitations.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnne

customer_reviews.title: The best coffee maker under $300
customer_reviews.text: All of the youtube reviews deliver on their promise. This coffee maker offers the best tasting home brewed coffee I've ever tasted. Make sure to use the correct ratio of coffee grounds to water. It blows my old cuisinart coffee maker out of the water (not even a fair match). This is a $150 coffee maker that makes coffee as good as a $300 coffee maker. If you want the best coffee at a reasonable cost, this is the coffee maker you have been looking for.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barron

customer_reviews.title: Fast, easy, high quality coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Fast, easy, simple to clean up. We drink a lot of coffee and after years of French Presses we made the switch back to a drip pot in order to make more coffee. This is the easiest to use and quickest coffee maker we’ve ever had and is really clean and efficient. Couldn’t recommend enough. Invest in a coffee bean grinder to go along with it for really fresh coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrie Talarico

customer_reviews.title: NOT A THERMAL CARAFE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Altho rated highly by ATK (which was disappointing) , after using it for about six months, I can say one good thing about it: It does make good coffee. Design flaws: 1.Carafe only keeps coffee warm for about two hours; thereafter, lukewarm. 2. Wide-mouth. ATK liked it because a small hand would fit inside for easy cleaning. (Must have small hand). 3. Wide-mouth also allows steam to escape thermal carafe during brewing which if sitting under an overhead cabinet, allows it to steam-clean underneath. 4. Don't even try pouring freshly brewed coffee out of the carafe without the lid screwed into place! (Must've been designed by an ex-YUGO engineer!!). Makes good coffee tho)
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Akward when brewing and having to remove carafe top.
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked and immeaditaly noticed to brew coffee you have to unscrew and remove carafe top and then slide pot under drip basket. Once brewing is done you have to remove carafe and replace top. Problem I have is I am not always at the coffee brewer when it is done (shower, getting ready, etc) meaning the pot is open at the top and coffee will get cold. Pain in the butt. Amazon will take it back (thank you) but I'm out of pocket for the flat bottom filters I purchased at groecery store.
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Carafe is great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why there are any bad reviews this coffee maker is amazing...people complained about the carafe not keeping the coffee warm...I swish a little warm or hot water in the carafe before I make a pot that's all it takes....make my pot of coffee which btw tastes so great! Anyways I put the lid on the carafe and when we did our first pot I noted the time...it was about 5 hours before I noticed the coffee wasn't hot anymore..but it wasn't cold either.. it was still warm into the afternoon! Just take the extra two mins to warm up the carafe and it's fine!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: difficult to screw on the top coffee leaks out. ...
customer_reviews.text: difficult to screw on the top coffee leaks out. don't buy the thermus version...... I am a Big Bonavita fan. This pot isnt worth the money or hassel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Frills - Great Coffee. What more do you really need?
customer_reviews.text: No frills, just great coffee. You may need to adjust the amount of coffee grounds needed to make YOUR perfect cup of coffee. The instructions call for using a bit too much coffee in the basket for my taste (and I like strong coffee) so it may take a couple of pots to get it right. But the simple, straight forward design looks great on the counter. The carafe keeps the coffee drinkably warm for several hours. So far, we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 8 cup Bonavita coffee maker a little over a year ago. It makes a pretty good cup of coffee in the morning and up until now have been pretty happy with it. This morning I discovered cracks in several places around the base of the water chamber. Not good. This coffee maker does not leave the counter. It's not like it's in a Travel Trailer or RV. I will be purchasing new coffee maker in the very near future but it will not be from this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: William S.

customer_reviews.title: Stops working.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in January 2018 and it has quit worked no. Tried to descale it to no avail. My prior Bonavita did the same thing but I got a little longer lifespan from that one. Extremely disappointed and would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Vagabondfcr

customer_reviews.title: Thermal Carafe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this not knowing how valuable a "thermal carafe" would be, but it suits our purposes perfectly. The coffee is brewed great, and once you are through brewing, you can take it off the machine. There is no hot plate. And, it keeps the coffee hot for quite some time. It is beautifully made. I like everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: it's a nice looking machine
customer_reviews.text: Did not live up to its hype. I returned it. Seemed to require a whole lot more coffee than my Cuisinart DCC-1200 to get an acceptable taste. I grind my beans in a Capresso 565, tried many different grind settings, but could never get an acceptable cup of coffee. Wish it worked out, it's a nice looking machine, but that's about all that's good about it in my opinion. I'll stick with my Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reeder

product_meta.title: Bonavita BV1900TS 8-Cup One-Touch Coffee Maker Featuring Thermal Carafe, Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Style:Stainless Steel CarafeWith a Bonavita coffee brewer, you're just one press of a button away from a perfect cup of coffee. We've refined our brewers down to the essential elements so it's simple to consistently brew great coffee. The excellence of the Bonavita 8-cup coffee brewer is recognized by the Specialty Coffee Association as part of its Certified Home Brewer Program. The Bonavita coffee brewer is designed to brew a full pot of coffee at 195-205°F. Once coffee comes in contact with air, the temperature will decrease significantly. Immediately after brewing a full pot, the temperature in the carafe is typically 175-185°F. Brewing a smaller batch or brewing at higher elevations may result in a lower temperature. Refer instruction manual before use.
feature_bullets: Carafe lid, filter basket, and showerhead are dishwasher safe
Powerful and precise 1500-watt heater maintains optimal brewing temperature of 195°-205°F (91°-96°C)
Optional pre-infusion mode wets freshly roasted ground coffee to allow degassing before brewing
Flat-bottomed filter basket and larger showerhead allow for even better saturation and uniform extraction
Durable stainless steel lined thermal carafe. Double walled stainless steel thermal carafe
